FuncDef: The test connectivity standing command performs a connectivity test on CES services.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an interface type.
Serial interface and Trunk-Serial interface.

Specifies the test time.
The value is an integer that ranges from 3 to 10, in second.

Examples: Info: Starting test on interface serial1/0/1:0 succeeded.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When a CES service is created on a serial interface, the PW status is Up, and the physical layer and protocol layer of the serial interface are Up. However, the CES service is still unavailable. Therefore, before running the CES service, you need to test the connectivity of the CES service.
Prerequisites
CES services have been deployed on the tested serial interface. This means that the serial interface has used TDM as the encapsulation protocol and joined the PW.
The physical layer status and protocol layer status on the serial interface are Up.
The PW which the serial interface joins is Up.
Local loopback has been configured on the corresponding interface, which is connected to the serial interface, on the other end of the PW.
Configuration Impact
Services will be interrupted during the PRBS test because local loopback is configured on the other end. You need to manually cancel the local loopback configuration on the other end after the test is completed.
